intro: Satyrium johnsonii, commonly known as Johnson's satyrium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and swampy areas. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insects. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
